snippet: Afghan security forces had advanced to the city center, but the situation appeared to be fluid as fighting continued and residents of nearby provinces prepared to leave.
abstract: Afghan forces continue to battle Taliban in Kunduz, as residents begin to flee in fear of wider Taliban offensive across country's north; United States military officials express exasperation at counterattack's ineffectiveness, but refrain from sending significant American reinforcements to help secure region; area offers lucrative drug routes coveted by Taliban, as they finance operations through poppy production.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ahmad Shakib and Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul, an employee of The New York Times from Baghlan, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Afghan security forces had advanced to the city center, but the situation appeared to be fluid as fighting continued and residents of nearby provinces prepared to leave.

headline.main: Afghan Forces Rally in Kunduz, but Fight Is Far From Decided
headline.print_headline: Afghan Forces Rally in Kunduz, but Fight Is Far From Decided

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
